paper.title: Automatic Detection of Uncertain Statements in the Financial Domain
paper.abstract: The automatic detection of uncertain statements can benefit NLP tasks such as deception detection and information extraction. Furthermore, it can enable new analyses in social sciences such as business where the quantification of uncertainty or risk plays a significant role. Thus, for the first time, we approached the automatic detection of uncertain statements as a binary sentence classification task on the transcripts of spoken language in the financial domain. We created a new dataset and - besides using bag-of-words, part-of-speech tags, and dictionaries - developed rule-based features tailored to our task. Finally, we analyzed systematically, which features perform best in the financial domain as opposed to the previously researched encyclopedic domain.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究的是自然语言处理（NLP）中的不确定语句自动检测，虽然应用场景是金融领域的语音转录文本，但其核心技术是句子分类和特征提取，并未直接涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等具体金融研究领域。
